job_data.description:
***An Important Note about Wayfair's In\-Office Policy and Salary:***



Please note that this is a hybrid role based in Boston, MA, and will require you to work in the office on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays.

  



The salary range for this position is $161,000 \- $172,500 per year. The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job\-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Restricted stock units will also be provided as part of the compensation package.

  


**Who We Are:**



At Wayfair, we’re transforming how people shop for their homes—and that same spirit of innovation drives how we scale our global workforce. The Talent Technology team sits at the intersection of People, Process, and Product, delivering solutions that power every stage of the employee journey.

  



As a Senior Product Manager, Talent Technology, you will lead end\-to\-end initiatives that redefine how employees experience support—from process design to systems implementation. You’ll own high\-impact projects that streamline operations, drive AI\-powered self\-service, and reduce manual intervention across the HR ecosystem. This role requires strong systems thinking, comfort with technical complexity, and the ability to align diverse stakeholders around common priorities. You’ll be responsible for evaluating and implementing third\-party solutions, redesigning business processes, and improving interoperability across platforms like Workday, Alight, Avature, Verint, and other HR technologies.

  


**What You’ll Do:**


* Drive the strategy and execution of AI\-enabled self\-service capabilities that reduce friction and empower employees
* Lead vendor evaluations and manage full lifecycle implementation of new tools, ensuring alignment with architectural and business goals
* Redesign and streamline process flows across core HR areas (e.g., recruiting, onboarding, time tracking, payroll, benefits)
* Uncover and address manual processes by leveraging Workday capabilities and other system features
* Lead discovery and reconfiguration efforts within Workday to optimize core workflows and drive measurable efficiencies
* Define and maintain a product roadmap that balances speed, scale, and long\-term impact
* Drive organization\-wide change management strategies, plan for successful adoption, and manage the learning curve across diverse stakeholder groups
* Collaborate with cross\-functional teams (Engineering, Legal, HR, Compliance) to align on technical feasibility, requirements, and compliance needs
* Translate complex business needs into clear product features, user flows, and outcomes
* Leverage data, experimentation, and feedback to drive continuous improvement
* Act as the connective tissue across stakeholder groups, ensuring shared understanding, accountability, and adoption

  


**What You’ll Need**


* 6–10 years of experience in product management or HR technology in a complex, matrixed environment
* Proven ability to lead end\-to\-end product delivery—from vendor selection through implementation and change adoption
* Strong systems thinking with experience mapping and redesigning workflows for efficiency
* Demonstrated success enabling automation, AI/ML, or self\-service tools within enterprise ecosystems

job_data.description:
#### **The base pay for this position is $198,000 \- $220,000 per year. The base pay offered may vary depending on location, job\-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Restricted stock units will be provided as part of the compensation package.**

**About this role**



We are looking for an experienced **Machine Learning Scientist III** to join our content recommendations team. In this role, you will be at the core of building and optimizing **ML\-based recommender systems** (e.g., image and content recommendations, homepage and email optimization and personalization) to enhance the customer experience at Wayfair. Your work will directly impact **how millions of customers** discover and engage with products, driving significant business value.



As part of Wayfair's **SMART (Search, Marketing, and Recommendations Technology)** team, you will collaborate with ML scientists, engineers, and product teams to **develop and deploy cutting\-edge recommendation models** that operate at scale. This role is an opportunity to **solve complex problems** related to personalization, large\-scale machine learning, latency, and scalability while leveraging **state\-of\-the\-art (SOTA) AI techniques.**


#### **What you’ll do**


* **Develop and optimize recommendation models** that power personalized experiences across Wayfair’s site, app, email, and push notifications.
* **Conduct applied research** to improve recommender systems using traditional ML techniques, deep learning and reinforcement learning.
* **Build scalable ML pipelines** for training, evaluation, and inference, ensuring models operate efficiently in production.
* **Work closely with engineering teams** to deploy models in a production environment, addressing real\-world constraints such as latency, interpretability, and scalability.
* **Analyze model performance and iterate** based on A/B test results, offline evaluation metrics, and business impact.
* **Leverage and contribute to open\-source ML frameworks** while staying up to date with cutting\-edge research in recommendation systems.
* **Drive innovation** by identifying opportunities to improve personalization strategies and developing novel algorithms that enhance customer engagement.
* **Collaborate with cross\-functional teams** including product managers, software engineers, and data scientists to align ML objectives with business goals.


**Mentor other less experienced scientists on the team**


#### **Who you are**


* **5\+ years of experience** developing and deploying machine learning models, with a focus on recommendations, ranking, or personalization.
* Strong theoretical understanding of **machine learning and deep learning** applied to large\-scale recommendation problems.
* Experience in **training, evaluating, and optimizing recommendation models** in production, leveraging techniques such as collaborative filtering, sequence modeling, representation learning and multi\-armed bandits.
* Proficiency in **Python** and experience with ML frameworks such as **TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Scikit\-Learn.**
* Familiarity with **big data processing** (Spark, Hadoop) and ML pipeline orchestration (Airflow, Kubeflow, MLflow).
* Strong coding skills and familiarity with **building scalable ML systems in cloud environments (AWS, GCP, Azure).**
* Ability to **design experiments and analyze results** using A/B testing and statistical techniques.
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to **explain complex ML concepts** to non\-technical stakeholders and drive data\-driven decisions.

#### **Nice to have**


* Experience developing **core recommendation systems** for **eCommerce, marketplaces, or streaming platforms.**
* Familiarity with **reinforcement learning or contextual bandits** for adaptive recommendation strategies.


This role offers the opportunity to work on **high\-impact ML problems at scale, shaping the future of personalization and recommendations at Wayfair.** If you're passionate about building intelligent systems that enhance customer experiences, we’d love to hear from you!

job_data.description:
*Candidates for this position must be based in Toronto, Canada or Boston, Massachusetts and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements (T/W/TH in office).*


**Head of Product, Data \& AI**


**Who You Are:**

  



Wayfair believes everyone deserves a home they love, and that furnishing your home should be a source of fun, not anxiety. These experiences are driven by a cutting\-edge set of data and machine learning, analytics, and operational systems that work in an integrated fashion to deliver a world class shopping experience for our customers. Business applications of these systems span many fields including recommendations, marketing, supply chain optimization and merchandising. These fields require a sophisticated technology stack that allows for configurability for rapid testing and exploration.

  



We are looking for a seasoned Product leader to join our Platforms Product team to lead a team of Product Managers working on multiple facets of our Data and AI Platforms, including real\-time, batch, analytics, and also Generative AI capabilities. These platforms are leveraged by nearly all our employees for operational and analytical purposes, or for powering our AI applications geared towards internal processes and our customer and supplier experiences.

  



We’re looking for someone who not only enjoys creating a bold vision, but also executing on their ideas through fruition on a global scale. In this role, you will own a range of products that will offer cloud native Data \& AI capabilities to our Engineers, Analysts, and Data Scientists developing customer and supplier\-focused platforms. Your goal will be to empower any team across the company with self\-service software (with data or AI needs) to deploy, manage, and integrate their applications utilizing our data platforms.

  



This person will act with a high degree of freedom and ownership, setting platform vision, forming strong relationships with senior cross\-functional partners (both technical and non\-technical), aligning on a shared vision for success, and delivering results that create meaningful business impact. This Product leader will serve as the subject matter expert, drive adoption for new use cases, and continually improve our platform capabilities. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in product management, a deep understanding of data technologies, and a proven track record of leading and developing high\-performing teams.

  


**What You’ll Do:**


* **Product Leadership**: Develop and drive the overall strategy for our Data \& AI Platforms, ensuring alignment with platforms strategy, along with delivering value for your users with in market usable solutions
* **AI Platforms**: Set strategic direction and drive execution for Generative AI capabilities that serve a range of personas, departmental and job function needs, supporting adoption and evangelization across the organization; identify and prioritize high\-value use cases, facilitate cross\-functional GenAI solutions tailored to diverse personas (developers, scientists, analysts), and guide build\-vs\-buy decisions to maximize scalability, effectiveness, and organizational impact.
* **Data Platforms**: Oversee the lifecycle of data platform products, including Data Movement technologies (batch and real\-time), Data Lakes, Data production and consumption patterns, quality management, enabling users to self\-service these capabilities on our Google Cloud environment
* **Team Management**: Lead, mentor, and manage a team of Product Managers, creating an integrated strategy across your products, fostering a culture of collaboration, measurement and creating space to learn and improve.
* **Stakeholder Collaboration:** Work closely with cross\-functional teams, including Engineering, Data Science, Analytics, and other key stakeholders to ensure our data platforms meet their needs and drive business value.
* **Market Analysis:** Stay abreast of industry trends and competitive landscape to inform product decisions and identify opportunities for innovation and improvement.
* **Product Metrics**: Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the success of data platform products and drive continuous improvement.
* **Driving adoption and value realization:** Market your product internally to various departments to ensure all available users know about your product and how they could value from it
* **Communication:** Articulate product vision, strategy, and roadmap to internal and external stakeholders, ensuring transparency and alignment across the organization. Maintain a product vision and roadmap, keeping stakeholders and constituents up to date on the top level goals and timelines

  


**We Are a Match Because You Have:**


* 7\+ years of experience in product management, with at least 3 years in a leadership role overseeing data and/or AI platforms
* 5\+ years of product experience in developing data\-driven products that are cloud native
* Strong understanding of data movement technologies (batch and real\-time), Data Lakes, analytical data systems, GenAI tools and applying models to real\-world problems.
* Strong written and verbal communication and a demonstrated ability to explain technical concepts to non\-technical audiences
* Proven experience in leading and collaborating with senior stakeholders along with a multi\-quarter roadmap with iterative value delivery
* Demonstrable ability to be technically hands\-on, up to architecting high\-level system plans (no coding)
* Understanding of big data technologies, data lakes, streaming / real\-time data solutions
* Understanding of Data \& AI Infrastructure tooling/solutions and scaling on public cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure)
* Ability to structure problems, develop clear hypotheses, and prioritize work against the largest impact initiatives
* Experience working with multiple engineering teams, running their sprints, stand\-ups, and backlog management
* Cultivate senior presence and be the leader of your portfolio of products

  


**Why You’ll Love Wayfair:**
